title: Unfair Ban - Ban Appeal
body:
Hi there, 
I have never received a suspension/ban before, or ever been explicitly much more vulgar then 99% of the community. Last night I was playing a normal blind pick game, where I had just got home from work and was on consistent 1k ping. I was not vulgar until the very last 2 seconds I said "ez %%%s" which isnt justifiable but half my team said it (therefore assuming they were suspended too?), which ended in me getting a 14 day suspension. Here are the chat logs:
Game 1
MrConception: who hasnt mate
MrConception: come on
MrConception: yikes
MrConception: nah i aint invading im lagging
MrConception: got wrong runes too
MrConception: sick
MrConception: just got home from work lmao
MrConception: lol
MrConception: lol
MrConception: we are fucking bot lane wtf
MrConception: yikes
MrConception: sure are ww
MrConception: in same house
MrConception: lagging too hard gonna b
MrConception: legend
MrConception: need 50 gold
MrConception: 1k ping relax
MrConception: i died bcz of my ping lol
MrConception: didnt we all
MrConception: i won like 3
MrConception: dude
MrConception: insta kill
MrConception: malz just e and ignite
MrConception: and ult me
MrConception: his e did 950 dmg to me lol
MrConception: i feel like ur the mad ones lol
MrConception: ^^
MrConception: ty
MrConception: im 1k ping stop sweating ya %%%
MrConception: guarantee this gnar has sweat dripping down his forhead rn
MrConception: lol why are we throwing
MrConception: i click to run away and just cant
MrConception: ez %%%s

I think this isn't sufficient for a 14 day suspension, had I been reported multiple times and had a collective of me insulting people, I would take the suspension gladly. But this isn't the case. Can something be done about this?
Thanks

replies.body: the first %%% was a harmless joking cuss like di ck head, but thanks heart vine ill give it a try

The thing to keep in mind is that it's generally more about how it's received than how it's intended, and that's true whether the case is addressed by the automated system or an actual person. A good rule of thumb is "if you wouldn't say it to someones face IRL, don't say it in-game" (more or less gives you an idea of what could get you in trouble).

As a young adult in Australia, me and everyone I know is generally pretty vulgar in day to day sentences and life, even at work, or uni things like di ckhead and pri ck are never taken personally, so i guess when i use them I may assume that's always the case

Thing is when you know people they typically become less sensitized to what you are saying. I could go up to one of my mates and call him a dickhead and he'd just shake it off and call me a bitch. No issue.

I wouldn't go up to a random and do the same thing because idk how they are going to react (also because its straight up weird and disrespectful, even in countries like NZ and AUS where people are more chill)

Same can be said in league, don't use any language that could be borderline offensive (or straight out slurs) in a game where you are with 9 other people you don't know how they will react. Keep it to discord banter with your mates, DMs or chat when you are full 5man.
You're totally right and I'm not disagreeing, but I almost feel like when theres a 'team' per say, that I'm in this environment of we're all here to have a laugh and have fun and whatever whatever.
Maybe that's my misjudgement, but never had this problem before, and I've been playing since season 1 lol

I think its just a sign of changing times. In the past two years especially, more and more people are speaking up about their experiences that are related to slurs. The community is adapting and realizing "hey, its not ok to use these words even in a casual manner". 
People see the stories of how these words are still used against others, and want to do their bit to ensure we can actually put (somewhat) of a stop to it. 

[This article here puts it quite well](https://www.huffingtonpost.com/casey-cavanagh/an-open-letter-to-people-_b_8011324.html), when we look at the word you used:

>I think you should use whatever words you want. When you use it on stage, I can see it’s funny, and I don’t care. But are you interested in what it might mean to gay men? Well, the word ‘f♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ t’ really means a bundle of sticks used for kindling in a fire. Now, in the middle ages, when they used to burn people they thought were witches? They used to burn homosexuals, too. And, they used to burn the witches at a stake, but they thought the homosexuals were too low and disgusting to be given a stake to be burnt on, so they used to just throw them in with the kindling, with the other f♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ s. So that’s how you get ‘flaming f♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ t.’

>**... You might wanna know that every gay man in America has probably had that word shouted at them while they’re being beaten up, sometimes many times, sometimes by a lot of people all at once. So, when you say it, it kind of brings that all back up. But, you know, by all means, use it. Get your laughs. But, you know, now you know what it means**. 

So while some people here don't really care what kind of language you use, others you come across in your games might have a lot of pain tied to such a word. On top of this, others might know someone who words like this have affected to the point where there were dire consequences and for that reason it will also resonate with them. Finally, we mustn't forget people that just don't like the use of those words for other reasons and still report it. 

* Its a lot better to use "mate" if you are reffering to a teammate instead of using a slur.
* If it is coming out as toxicity, its better just to say nothing at all. If people really can't resist "potato" is a great word to use. _(Although it can be assured that by calling out your teammate for doing something you wouldn't do isn't gonna make them play better.)_

I'd have reported you just to bring up cases like this. Good luck seras trying to tell this guy the report system works lol.

You didn't deserve it. Obviously reading the chat there was no negativity/abuse intended. Which is why the report system is fucking retarded.

In cases with slurs, its a bit harsher. 

It doesn't matter if it was intended to be negative or not, it's pretty clear and simple that a lot of players don't want those kinds of words in their games in any capacity.

Sorry to be the one to say that you are complete full of it. No one in this game was offended. And if they reported him and he didn't just get auto detected for profanity, then they were either trolling or they are a very angry individual and they are the toxic ones. 

Read through the whole chat-log again and honestly tell me he was toxic. He seems like one of the most laid back players especially considering he was lagging to such a high degree. It's disgusting that this decision can be justified by saying "someone got offended, so even if he wasn't really offensive or intending to be offensive, he still gets punished".

That logic is fundamentally flawed. I can virtually guarantee that no one was offended by what this guy said but if we assume they were, why should he get banned based on their subjective feelings. If he said something objectively wrong or mean, I would agree with a ban. He didn't though, he just used profanity that some people (whom, I am unsure of) might subjectively disagree with it.

This is not toxic and the only reason he got banned was because he used naughty words that Riot doesn't like, not because he targeted or accidentally offended another player with his language.

I never said he was toxic??

_**I literally just pointed out that slurs are treated more harshly than any other words or the typical garden variety flame. **_

Riots IFS review system is based on reports, and even if slurs and profanity were used, if no-one reports then you won't get punished for it. Obviously someone in the game (regardless of "friendly banter context") **was** offended or recognized that word as something they didn't want themselves or other members of the community exposed to, a report was lodged, game was reviewed, words that people report a lot were found, and a punishment was issued. 


It's not just Riot and members of this community that think slurs are naughty. I think you'll find you'll get in deep shit if you use that kind of language around work/school or any less than familiar social setting when you are with strangers.

Many people who are actually toxic would get tilted by losing a game and report enemy players for something that was obviously not offensive. The majority of young adults in todays society treat cuss words like they would any other word. Ive lived in both Australia and New Zealand and a common greeting could be something along the lines of "sup c*nt" . This was obviously not intended to be offensive and he was probably reported by an enemy player who was salty about losing a game. Bans need to be looked over by a human who can read in context and make an informed decision not a computer program that looks for words or phrases that are considered offensive. 


Here's an example, a player makes an awesome play that potential turns around a game, "you are f%cking insane" followed by "that was awesome" would obviously be a compliment. Computer system would analyze the chat and determine that "you are f%cking insane" is verbal abuse and hand out a punishment. Any ban should be confirmed by a human that can read in context.

> Read through the whole chat-log again and honestly tell me he was toxic.

He was toxic. Regardless of the intent, the fact remains that the term used (specifically "f*g") is one that is, in modern society, often associated with a severe negative connotation that directly targets homosexual individuals. If people want to do that in privacy, in situations where those involved are ok with such usage, that's their business, but the very fact that the OP has received a punishment for the behaviour certainly indicates that someone in that match was offended by the use of the term, otherwise there would have been no report and, thus, no punishment.

To say that you think there is nothing wrong with what they did is not the point, that is your *opinion* and not consistent with *Riot's policies*, and since it is Riot's game, they are the ones to decide how harassment, especially when talking about things like homophobia, is dealt with. Yaia's logic on this is not flawed, it is based on how Riot treats their game, and how they "translate" behaviours considered undesirable by society into the game and it's systems.

The bottom line is that he did the wrong thing and ended up offending someone, whether intentional or not, and so Riot dealt with the behaviour.

Your uptight attitude proves that you have no clue what could be justice here. "f*g" means a cigarette butt, but lets not beat around the bush, it is a shortened slur. I'm not arguing that Riot doesn't have the authority, I am saying that he is clearly a laid back guy and got banned for an auto-detection and if you are gonna sit here and say "he did the wrong thing and ended up offending someone" you are literally arguing a robot's point for it and it's hilarious.

OP admitted to doing the wrong thing, and given the context of the use of the word, it certainly doesn't suggest it was used to refer to a cigarette butt.

Maybe instead of complaining that someone is "uptight", you should just accept that there are certain things that take toxicity way to far and shouldn't be happening in-game at all.

Your best bet at getting a ban revoked is to appeal via [Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) (just pick the "I have a question about a suspension or restriction on my account" option and go from there). That said, I doubt this would be revoked, especially if there are chat restrictions in your history. There are a few types of chat behaviour that Riot takes more seriously, among which is "homophobia", which if I'm understanding correctly, is what this would be categorised as (certainly doesn't help that the term in question was used twice). You can try, but I wouldn't expect anything to come of it if I were you.

If you have honestly never been punished or banned before or actually never been generally toxic u have been really hard done by in this case, i mean depending on how vulgar the homophobic slur was but still riot themselves claims 2 week and insta bans are only given out in EXTREME CIRCUMSTANCES.  This is quite minor and i'm pretty stunned this has got a 2 week ban (taking u at your word its your first offense and generally are not toxic) usually the 2 week bans come after paragraphs of vulgar and offensive language throughout an entire game.. you  literally said 1 word. Id recommend submitting a ticket to riot about this but considering it was a homophobic slur and god forbid if our society didn't adhere to whatever gay people say (equality and all the rest) so riot will probably say there is  no tolerance. Hopefully they lift the ban to a chat ban or some shit but man.. This one is really unlucky ngl.
Yeah, honest to god never had another punishment.
Whatever the % signs indicate is probably one of those insta-ban words that are automatically picked up by the system.
It was a homophobic slur, but surely 1 word said 1 time wouldnt suggest a 14 day ban? And as I said, my entire team said it so if they weren't also banned that'd just be unconventional.

No it'd just be the shitty report system.

They only get checked if there are reports, they probably reported you for lols, and given your reaction, you likely DIDN'T report them and they got away with it.

EDIT: Love the downvotes here, with no responses, we not going to respond to the fact that you may as well just run everyone's chat and not just those reported?

I don't care what anyone on this post responds with, this is 0% toxic in any receiving way. This guy seems like the most laid back and chill person I have ever seen. He is lagging on 1000 ping and not getting stressed out or flaming or anything. This is a rare case where he got auto-banned for using oh so precious swears. I would definitely agree with a reversal of the punishment in this particular instance.

I read the whole thing and haven't seen any insults period, much less directed at any individual. No person in their right mind can take offence to his remarks. The only way this ban makes sense is that he got banned for simply using the language. Lets be real. No Rioter looked through this and determined that he is a toxic player. If you want to point me to a human that genuinely read this and thought he deserves a 14 day ban on this game alone, I would say they should be fired. They would be doing their player behavioural systems a great dis-service.

This is not justice. This guy is just trying to make the light of an otherwise bleak situation, and you are punishing him saying he is a bad-tempered ill-meaning person. How dare you. These are some of the only people that keep coming back and playing League. You are banning your core player-base now. This is embarrassing.
Lol theres no such thing as a bit harsher.. the way their penalty system is just harsh, period.
